intro: Vismia obtusa, commonly known as the rough vismia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Vismia obtusa is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural studies.
